DataElement.preferredName: Person Tissue Microarray Clinical Trial Registration Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has registered to participate on a research study designed to evaluate the utility of tissue microarrays, a device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens by spatially arranging 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Tissue Microarray Clinical Trial Registration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the registration or enrollment of a person on a research study designed to evaluate the utility of tissue microarrays, a device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens by spatially arranging 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.

Property.preferredDefinition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
